analysis: The documents consist of executive orders, primarily focused on granting access to tax returns to various committees and subcommittees of the House of Representatives and the Senate. The reasons for granting access vary, including investigations into specific industries (e.g., wool, airplanes), government operations, and potential subversive activities. The orders cite the legal authority for granting access, referencing specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code and other revenue acts. The documents span several presidencies, from Woodrow Wilson to Richard Nixon, indicating a long-standing practice of allowing congressional oversight through tax return inspection.
title: Tax Return Access for Congressional Investigations
